text: The Culper spy ring was a network of civilian spies which played an important role in the American Revolutionary War. They gave information about British troop movements to General George Washington. The network was led by Abraham Woodhull, who used the pseudonym Samuel Culper. For this reason, the network was called the Culper spy ring. ==References== Category:American Revolutionary War Category:Espionage Category:George Washington Category:History of New York City Category:Secret societies Category:United States intelligence agencies
title: Culper spy ring
